23 //Callback Funktionen
24 //If an image is published load it into the global variable
25 void cam1_cb (const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& input)
26 {
27  cam1=*input;
28  ROS_INFO("Input from cam1");
29 
30  //Convert ROS image message to CvImage suitable for OpenCV
31  try
32  {
33  cv_ptr1 = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(input, sensor_msgs::image_encodings::BGR8);
34  }
35  catch (cv_bridge::Exception& e)
36  {
37  ROS_ERROR("cv_bridge exception: %s", e.what());
38  return;
39  }
40 }
41 
42 int main(int argc, char **argv)
43 {
44 
45  ros::init(argc, argv, "img_stitch");
46 
47  ros::NodeHandle n;
48 
49  //Create a publisher for the stitched images
50  ros::Publisher image_pub = n.advertise<sensor_msgs::Image>("stitched", 1);
51 
52  //Publish-rate [Hz]
53  ros::Rate loop_rate(1);
54 
55  //Create ROS subscribers for the input images
56  ros::Subscriber sub1 = n.subscribe ("/camera/image", 1, cam1_cb);
57 
58  int count = 0;
59  while (ros::ok())
60  {
61  if ( cv_ptr1 )
62  {
63  //Here is usually your stitching-routine.
64  // Error won't occur here:
65  //image = cv_ptr1->image; //Load the cv_bridge image into an OpenCV Matrix
66 
67  //Convert cv::Mat stitched to ROS image
68 
69 
70  // after you have processed the image your might want to release them
71  // so your node does not process the same images multiple times
72  // reset the ptrs and wait for the callbacks to fill them again
73  cv_ptr1.reset();
74  }
75  else
76  {
77  // nothing can be done here; we have to spin and wait for images to arrive
78  }
79 
80  ros::spinOnce();
81 
82  loop_rate.sleep();
83  ++count;
84  }
85 
86 
87  return 0;
88 }
